metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3563 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in Linux Kernel. Affected is the function read_50_controller_cap_complete of the file tools/mgmt-tester.c of the component BlueZ. The manipulation of the argument cap_len leads to null pointer dereference. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. VDB-211086 is the identifier assigned to this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3563` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-cups - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-hcidump - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-meshd - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-obexd - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-tests - 5.65-0ubuntu1
libbluetooth3 - 5.65-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> introduced in 5.56 This flaw is only in the mgmt-tester tool in the bluez-tests package in universe, this isn't normally used

criterions.comment: bluez package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.65-0ubuntu1').
